wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.operation.convolve

Interface ConvolutionFactoryBase

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BlurFactory
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlurFactoryGeneric, BlurFactoryIJ, ConvolutionFactoryBaseGeneric

    public interface ConvolutionFactoryBase
    Author:
    remy This class is a base class for convolution masks Factories, and provides utilities to enable signed representations for voxel values, embed output buffers so that the values can be (to some extent) added, possibly subtracted, or multiplied by a limitted factor without incurring overflows.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getIdentityMask

        ConvolutionBase getIdentityMask()
        Returns:
        A mask that does nothing with the same input and output buffer as this one.

      • embedOutput

        ConvolutionFactoryBase embedOutput(boolean autoAllowSignedValues,
                                   int bitDepth)
        Produces a GRAY16 image that can hold greater values than the original output image. The output image underlying this instance is replace by the new one. This allows operations such as difference or linear combination of images without overflows. If the original image is GRAY8, this is done by creating an image with 16 bits per pixel by copying the values without scaling (hence values are less than 256). If the original image is GRAY16, then the values are divided by 256 (hence values also are less than 256). If the resulting image is intended to allow for negative values (e.g. to compute differences), the gray levels are shifted by adding a value (Short.MAX_VALUE-Short.MIN_VALUE)/2 = 32767.
        Parameters:
        autoAllowSignedValues - If true, the gray levels are shifted to start in the middle of the range of a short value.
        bitDepth - The target bit depth
        Returns:
        The reference to this instance to allow for use of the cascade pattern.

      • enlargeInImage

        ConvolutionFactoryBase enlargeInImage(int xMargin,
                                      int yMargin,
                                      int zMargin,
                                      BufferEnlargementPolicy enlargementPolicy)
        Allows to enlarge the input image to prevent masks to reach outside the input image. The enlargement policy allows to choose which values should be used when accessing the added margins.
        Parameters:
        xMargin - Width of the margin to add on both sides
        yMargin - Height of the margin to add on both sides
        zMargin - Depth of the margin to add on both sides
        enlargementPolicy - Specifies the policy to initialize the new voxel values.
        Returns:
        The reference to this instance to allow for use of the cascade pattern.

      • getInImageSignPolicyEmbed

        ImageSignPolicyEmbed getInImageSignPolicyEmbed()
        Allows to retrieve the input image without any normalization.
        Returns:
        The embedded image in this current state.

      • getCroppedInImage

        ImageCore getCroppedInImage()
        Allows to retrieve the input image without any normalization.
        Returns:

      • getOutImageSignPolicyEmbed

        ImageSignPolicyEmbed getOutImageSignPolicyEmbed()
        Allows to retrieve the output image without any normalization.
        Returns:
        The embedded image in this current state.
